Class HDLC

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.comm.ntcip.HDLC
public abstract class HDLC extends Object
This is an implementation of the ISO/IEC standard 3309 High-level Data Link Control (HDLC) protocol, or rather, the subset of it which is described in NEMA TS 3.3-1996 (NTCIP Class B profile).
Author:
Douglas Lau

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    HDLC.AddressedInputStream
    A FilterInputStream which is tied to a specific HDLC address.
    static class 
    HDLC.AddressedOutputStream
    A FilterOutputStream which is tied to a specific HDLC address.
    static class 
    HDLC.FrameInputStream
    A FilterInputStream which reads messages framed with a FLAG octet and performs a transparency technique to collapse ESCAPE sequences into single octets.
    static class 
    HDLC.FrameOutputStream
    A FilterOutputStream which frames messages with a FLAG octet and performs a transparency technique to ensure the FLAG is not contained within the frame.

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected static final byte
    ADDRESS_GROUP
    Mask for group address
    protected static final byte
    ADDRESS_LAST
    Mask for last byte of the address field
    protected static final int
    BIT6
    BIT6 is the sixth bit (starting from 1).
    protected static final byte
    CONTROL_UI
    Unnumbered Information with poll bit set
    protected static final byte
    CONTROL_UIF
    Unnumbered Information Final (response)
    protected static final byte
    CONTROL_UP
    Unnumbered Poll
    protected static final EOFException
    END_OF_STREAM
    End of stream exception
    protected static final int
    ESCAPE
    ESCAPE is a single octet which is used for replacing octets within the frame which happen to be equal to FLAG (or ESCAPE).
    protected static final int
    FLAG
    FLAG is a single octet which signifies the start and end of each HDLC frame.
    protected static final int
    FRAME_CHECK
    Frame check sequence is two bytes
    protected static final int
    IPI
    Initial Protocol Identifier
    protected static final int
    MAX_MESSAGE
    Maximum message size
    protected static final int
    NTCIP_MAX_ADDRESS
    NTCIP class B addresses are restricted to 13 bits
